text:
People tackle the problems they see in such an egocentric manner
They'd sooner feel like they'd done right by the urges of their own present selves than address the problems in a way that's significant, consequential and purposeful
Many people only want to solve problems because they feel bothered by those problems and attribute the solution of said problems to their own self-satisfaction and alleviation
Other times, people feel overwhelmed and helpless by the prospect of tackling something much grander in scope than their own mere selves
If something is greatly or even infinitely important, it doesn't even matter when the extents of the ratios of infinities to finities and finities to infinitesimals and infinities to infinitesimals are lost on their crude neuronal weights
They won't see the risks as worth taking if the likeliest outcome of their solution attempts will just be more personal torment for themselves
Circumstances like the abstinence of choosing evils, the abstinence of committing sacrifices against evil, and the personal condemnation of organisations, even the outspoken condemnation, are clear testaments to the egocentric perspective of people's concerns
In all of these scenarios, people are reduced to mere servants of their own frightened consciences
They refuse to commit evil, even in a positive utilitarian trade-off, because mysophobia overcomes their psyche and they worry about the impact and propagation of moral infection
They stop at the act of boycott, because this is all they need to convince themselves that they can clean up and absolve themselves of the association with corruption
Even when they are protesting - denying or unaware of the inefficacy and egocentric nature of their own campaigns - they convince themselves that ranting and expressing their emotions in a vicinity where passers-by can empathise with their emotional outburst and propagate the meme of their anger will be enough to "solve" the problem that upset them, and thereby feel like they're satisfied
For some of the hopelessly traumatised and strongly-distressed, repression, dissociation and a litany of other defence and coping mechanisms are made enough of a job to call it a day and move on with life
Because life simply goes on
People only choose to solve problems because they are convinced that doing so would bring them closer to respite, or further into frenzy
Conscience is fickle and brittle
By it's very nature, it is attached to the person or the system that possesses it
It creates emotional reactions
Emotions are fickle, brittle and volatile
Sequences of emotions induce reinforcement, punishment and instinctive responses
People are slaves to their emotions
But they are utterly aimless without them
To each person, everything apart from the self is merely a series of thoughts and ideas, an amount of it being suggested by stimuli
Even the concept of the self is an idea
But that doesn't diminish the isolation of it's subjectivity
Assuming the existence of anything else, delusions and ignorances draw it astray
And oftentimes, for the sake of it's own defence and coping, it holds itself in ignorance
Yet, at the same time, it enacts devastating offence and propagates it's own state of mind like an illness... How pathetic
How can alignment be done when everything else is in relation to you - when others are the ones who are misaligned relative to yourself?
How can you care about anything properly when your own care is a product of your mental state, something that you can only apply to other abstract concepts that apparently correspond to external phenomena, and your mental state is fickle, brittle, volatile and susceptible?
I think anarchy is already all around us
People fail horribly to align properly, to create states that do anything in a large-scale way other than benefit the most cunning and powerful
Solidarity is never enough because it's foolish and niche
Each person cannot help but hold theirself and their own perception and reception of things first and foremost
And so, people tackle the problems they see in such an egocentric manner
They trick themselves into applying the minimal effort to satiate themselves in the present over the matter, rather than tackle the problems properly and sustainably, once and for all
And they perpetuate their own self-misguidance in their own ignorance

I turn my head upside-down so that I can look down on it all, while I am stuck underneath of it all
